info.title: BetterDoctor
info.description: BetterDoctor helps people find and connect to the best doctors through our consumer app, doctor marketing services, and API. Our mission is to help increase transparency in healthcare and help consumers make better decisions.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The doctor's name; searches in both first and last names. Partial (type-ahead) characters/names are accepted.

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: The doctor's first name; partial (type-ahead) characters/names are accepted.

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: The doctor's last name; partial (type-ahead) characters/names are accepted.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search all fields by a keyword query (e.g. 'Toothache').

parameters.name: specialty_uid
parameters.description: UID of a specialty (e.g. 'pediatrician'); will accept a comma-separated list of multiple specialties.

parameters.name: insurance_uid
parameters.description: UID of an insurance plan (e.g. 'aetna-aetnabasichmo'); will accept a comma-separated list of multiple insurances.

parameters.name: practice_uid
parameters.description: BetterDoctor Practice UID. Supplying this parameter will return only doctors linked to that practice.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Search area - Either Circular (lat,lon,range (miles)) or Bounding box (top-right, bottom-left) (lat,lon,lat,lon). Location slugs (ca-berkeley) are also accepted. Slugs are returned as part of the doctor's practices. For convenience we also support state (ny or NY) postal codes.

parameters.name: user_location
parameters.description: User's current location. (lat, lon). This impacts ordering of practices in results, and determines each value of [practice].distance.

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: The doctor's gender ('male' or 'female').

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order for the search results ('full-name-asc': Alphabetical sort by full provider name ascending. 'full-name-desc': Alphabetical sort by full provider name descending. 'last-name-asc': Alphabetical sort by provider's last name ascending. 'last-name-desc': Alphabetical sort by provider's last name descending. 'first-name-asc': Alphabetical sort by provider's first name ascending. 'first-name-desc': Alphabetical sort by provider's first name descending. 'best-match-asc': Sort by BetterDoctor'

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include. You may use nested fields, e.g.: field1,field2(subfield,subfield2).

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: For paginated list operations; specifies the zero-based start index of the first item to retrieve.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For paginated list operations; specifies the maximum number of items to retrieve. Maximum value of limit is 100. Values greater than maximum value get converted to the maximum value.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: Your API access key

get.description: Results are provider service locations, commonly referred as practices or doctor's offices.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The doctor's name; searches in both first and last names. Partial (type-ahead) characters/names are accepted.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Search area - Either Circular (lat,lon,range (miles)) or Bounding box (top-right, bottom-left) (lat,lon,lat,lon). Location slugs (ca-berkeley) are also accepted. Slugs are returned as part of the doctor's practices. For convenience we also support state (ny or NY) postal codes.

parameters.name: user_location
parameters.description: User's current location. (lat, lon). This impacts ordering of practices in results, and determines each value of [practice].distance.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order for the search results ('full-name-asc': Alphabetical sort by full provider name ascending. 'full-name-desc': Alphabetical sort by full provider name descending. 'last-name-asc': Alphabetical sort by provider's last name ascending. 'last-name-desc': Alphabetical sort by provider's last name descending. 'first-name-asc': Alphabetical sort by provider's first name ascending. 'first-name-desc': Alphabetical sort by provider's first name descending. 'best-match-asc': Sort by BetterDoctor'

get.summary: Retrieve a specific practice description using NPI
get.description: Returns a practice object based on an NPI. The office returned is registered in the NPI directory. There may be additional offices with this NPI registered at this location. Use the /practices search to find additional locations.

parameters.name: npi
parameters.description: The National Provider Identifier of the doctor to retrieve

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include. You may use nested fields, e.g.: field1,field2(subfield,subfield2).

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: Your API access key

post.description:
Creates validation document using the request body, and returns the document created with unique identifier in Location header for reference. This is how validation data is submitted to BetterDoctor for addition to the API. The posted document must conform to BetterDoctor???s JSON schema for validation objects, see included model specification for more information.

Return Headers

Location: The uid of the created document. This can be use

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: Your API access key

get.description:
The endpoint can be used to identify providers with validation data. The search supports BetterDoctor unique provider identifier, National Provider Identifier (NPI) or reference uid based provider lookups. BetterDoctor identifiers and NPIs for doctors and practices can be discovered using BetterDoctor API???s search functionalities.

Return Headers

Last-Modified: Timestamp of the last validation made over the matching validations. The val

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description: Provider type to search validations for. For example ???Doctor??? or ???Practice???.

parameters.name: data_uid
parameters.description: Paired with data_type. Unique object identifier for the provider type.

parameters.name: npi
parameters.description: Paired with data_type. National Provider Identifier (NPI) for the given provider type.

parameters.name: ref_uid
parameters.description: Optional to data_type style queries. Reference uid for the validation context, usually 3rd party reference uid provided upon creation of the validation document

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Limits validations returned to the validations after the given timestamp value (ISO 8601). Equivalent to using If-Modified-Since HTTP header.

parameters.name: validation_method
parameters.description: Limits validations returned to a validation method wanted. For example ???call??? or ???online???.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: For paginated list operations; specifies the zero-based start index of the first item to retrieve.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For paginated list operations; specifies the maximum number of items to retrieve. Maximum value of limit is 100. Values greater than maximum value get converted to the maximum value.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: Your API access key

head.description: The endpoint can be used to identify providers with validation data, and discover changes. It providers search functionalities like its GET method alternative, but does not return any validation data. Instead of the data itself, it returns 200 OK if matching validation documents based on the given query are found. And it returns 304 if no validation documents are found after the timestamp given using If-Modified-Since HTTP header or since parameter.

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description: Provider type to search validations for. For example ???Doctor??? or ???Practice???.

parameters.name: data_uid
parameters.description: Paired with data_type. Unique object identifier for the provider type.

parameters.name: npi
parameters.description: Paired with data_type. National Provider Identifier (NPI) for the given provider type.

parameters.name: ref_uid
parameters.description: Optional to data_type style queries. Reference uid for the validation context, usually 3rd party reference uid provided upon creation of the validation document

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Limits validations returned to the validations after the given timestamp value (ISO 8601). Equivalent to using If-Modified-Since HTTP header.

parameters.name: validation_method
parameters.description: Limits validations returned to a validation method wanted. For example ???call??? or ???online???.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: For paginated list operations; specifies the zero-based start index of the first item to retrieve.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For paginated list operations; specifies the maximum number of items to retrieve. Maximum value of limit is 100. Values greater than maximum value get converted to the maximum value.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: Your API access key

get.description:
Returns requested validation document. The endpoint is a conveniece method to check status and accepted data of a specific validation, like after creation of a validation. The response consist of raw data from the validation event and related validation information.

Return Headers

Last-Modified: Timestamp of the validation made.

parameters.description: BetterDoctor Doctor UID

parameters.description: Your API access key

head.summary: Check if a specific record exists
head.description:
The endpoint can be used to discover if a validation document exists in the API.

Return Headers

Last-Modified: Timestamp of the validation made.
